title: 1.6 update is great!
comment: Brings a lot of the great features from the desktop version of gnucash. And it finally has an open xml file option. Reports. Backup to Dropbox plus Google drive. But please add Google drive to the open file option. I can only see Dropbox.

If you still experience some issues, please email details to gnucash.org@gmail.com
Cheers,
Great app for a great product!

I love opensource, this is the best money manager by far. Yes, it takes a little getting around but once you get it it's awesome. One thing I would like to see is receipt attachments on phones and tablets like the desktop version.   Being able to take a picture or scan one with a phone and attach it to your transaction and exported to my desktop app would be awesome. one more thing, it would also be nice to see some kind of indicator by the transaction to let you know that there's a receipt attached. Would be great for the desktop version as well ,  thank you..

title: Nice
comment: Bookkeepers stink.  We put them down the sink. Gnuchess and Gnucash we love within a wink.

Whenever I buy stock in the app while attempting to deposit to that account and withdraw from my chequing account, it treats it as a negative value and deposits into my chequing account. This is reversed when selling. So, I regularly buy -$XXX.xx of a stock? It should be taking the money from chequing and giving it to the stock account when I buy, not the other way around. I don't know about you, but I don't often buy a negative amount of something.

I see a lot of promise here but for my purposes it's not usable. I wanted to use it as a data collector for the desktop master file, without sync issues and without carrying financial data with me. The intent was to export and then wipe all transactions. Export only offers two file format options, one of which does not support double entry accounting, leaving me with QIF. Export seems OK and the transactions are deleted as desired, but importing the QIF into the desktop software reveals problems. The Note field is not included in the QIF, the date format is apparently too ambiguous sometimes and prompts for a fix that is not always usable (breaks the import), and the import sequence is a long and too-interactive wizard. I thought I might use this anyway but have found it really doesn't add anything. For someone who wants to use the Android app as their sole financial tool, this might be an OK solution, although the UI needs a lot of work. For me... well, I'm going to uninstall it.

title: Great Companion to the Desktop
comment: Add your expenses as they happen; then use the power if your desktop to generate reports

comment: Easy and convenient, remembers things to speed up entry. Just one serious annoyance during my use: if the export fails (e.g. I don’t finish the Share file dialog for some reason), the new transactions are nevertheless marked as exported and there is no way to try exporting them again.

The only way would be to export all transactions (if you've not deleted them).
But we are working on improving this in future releases.

It feels complete except for lack of budget and reports features and easy sync. I miss them badly(i m sure many would). Hoping for these to come in the next release. Anyway kudos to the team!

title: Great and flexible
comment: Working great for me, it will be great if there's a way to show current month transaction instead of sum amount so that I can better monitor my expenses. Well, since we can import account, can we choose to import current month income/expenses transaction only?

We are working to include some reporting features which can help with overview of finances.
At the moment, we can only import a whole GnuCash XML file (not parts of it). 
Cheers,

title: Most required app
comment: Love the double entry system. Easy to use. Why don't you add an easy reporting view with graphs? Users will be able to see their spending distribution etc.. Also need option to clear Recent Accounts history

Thanks for the feedback. 
We are working on generating reports, and the first fruits of that labour will come in the next version.
Recent accounts always shows you the accounts where transactions were recently saved. The only way to clear it is to clear the transactions themselves.
Cheers,

title: Great and free Open source app!!!
comment: (I've already edited my comment) I apologize, this is my first time using this app or any other accounting app. So I didn't realize until now that *.qif are only to save transactions in order to import them back into the desktop version account.   Also, I use this app because I don't trust in private accounting software, either online or desktop version. I want to keep my data safe, not sold to any other private company or to the government.  Thanks for the app, you are doing a great job.

title: Greatly  complement desktop version
comment: I am using it for tracking of cash and than I import it to desktop version where I have bank accounts. The homescreen widged is very useful.  Only inconvenience are the cents. As I am mostly using currency without cents I need to enter double zero at the end of every amount. It would be nice to be able to turn off this feature in settings.

Thanks for the feedback! We plan to fix this issue in future versions.

title: Great companion app!
comment: Great way for me keep track of my transactions while on the go. My request would be to have it import my favorites (i.e. my checking) automatically from my Dropbox or Drive to check my balances, read-only would be perfect.

comment: I have used YNAB. This is much better as it gives me freedom. It would have been awesome if the app could sync over drive.

title: Very useful App, BUT
comment: I use it a lot to update Gnucash Windows. BUT, it doesn't seem to export data in the Notes field. I have to do this manually after importing. Also it doesn't handle the date too well. Gnucash asks for the setting on import but does not offer d-m-y.

Thanks for the feedback. 
As for the Notes field, we have not yet found a way to reliably export it in the QIF format. But we are aware of the issue. 
GnuCash Android exports with the date format y-m-d. Do you mean you would like to see it offer other formats for export?
Keep the feedback coming and you can mail any issues to gnucash.org@gmail.com

title: Import requires third party app
comment: Importing the account tree used in a desktop version of GnuCash requires a third party app to find files. Despite already having an app to do that on, for example, a Samsung device, you still need something else. That fact is not mentioned in the store description or the app itself.

You need an app on your device which can read files from the SD card (or whatever cloud storage you use) and provide them to the app. 
Try the OI File Manager from the Play Store.

title: Polished except
comment: If i understand it correctly, this would be way more practical if it could import GnuCash transactions, not just whole accounts with their transactions. Sync is not possible because the app does not write out GnuCash XML, only imports.
I have made a note about account separator, we may add it at some point. You're the first to ask for it! :)

title: Problems deleting transactions
comment: Generally a very good app but since the last update, when deleting one side (say debit) of a transaction, the other side (credit) miraculously stays in its account, leading to an imbalance. This is obviously a major issue. Reinstalling didn't seem to fix the problem. Also, the auto-complete function for a transaction doesn't work properly anymore either, not allowing a choice of account for the counter side, nor the type of transaction (debit/credit). Real shame, app was working much better previously.

Hi, 
thanks for the feedback! 
The issue with deleting transactions has been fixed in v1.5.2.
With Autocomplete, it is necessary to use the split editor to modify the type and amount.
But I will look to simplifying this for future releases.
Nice

Sync is not possible because there is no feature parity between the desktop and Android app.

title: Does what it says

title: Won't Import Files from DropBox
comment: I use GnuCash an multiple computer in conjunction with DropBox. I hoped and expected this application would give me some basic functionality to my GnuCash files. I was disappointed. Maybe I am doing something wrong.

Hi Phillip, This is a companion application to GnuCash desktop. It is mainly for making on-the-go records of transactions and later importing them to your GnuCash file. The app is not designed to interface directly with your GnuCash file/database.
Cheers,

comment: Double entry needs to support more than two accounts involved in a transaction. Without that, it's not useful for me.

title: Good but will be perfect when it syncs with my desktop
comment: I use Gnucash on my desktop at home, and needed something to keep track of my finances when I am away, on my Hudl.  This works very well once you get to know the limitations i.e. You can only import your account structure from the desktop [I did it through Dropbox].  So I just worked out how much money would be left in each account after regular payments and just before the next credit went in, and used that as an opening balance.  Apart from cash in wallet which is obviously the amount you have when you leave home.  When I can just synch this app to my desktop with all transactions incl. future regular ones, I will give it five stars and contribute!

title: Forcing account transfers
comment: I have not enabled linking transactions in the settings, but now it is mandatory to select a transfer account for each transaction I make. I'm not doing the heavy lifting from my phone. Gnucash is a temporary imnfo dock that i import to gnucash on the computer later. Just allow me to make simple notes without linking my accounts. I want to subtract money on my phone when I'm out and about shopping. That's it. Start the transaction account linking drop down with "none" you've added an extra click to my flow.

comment: What's the point of using this app if you can't export from one phone to another? Same app version same structure same everything you just can't use same accounts as one phone on another.

title: Problems while importing
comment: When I open the App --> settings --> Accounts --> Import GNUCash Accounts , it opens a window titled "choose music track" and displays music files. How am I supposed to import the account structure ?

Hi, the app needs a file provider app to be installed on your device. See this post for details about importing: http://www.codinguser.com/2014/03/gnucash-android-account-import-guide/

Hope this helps!

title: Keeps crashing when importing account structure
comment: Can't use this app; everytime I try to import my account structure from GNU Cash desktop it crashes, I only get a "the process org.gnucash.android has stopped" message.  The only reason for using this app is to have a companion app to easily register transactions with your account structure and later export them into the desktop application, but if I can't use my account structure then it's of no use.  I'm using the latest version 1.3.3 in a Samsung Galaxy S4 running android 4.2.2

Hi, sorry about the issues you're having. Please see this blog post for details about importing: http://www.codinguser.com/2014/03/gnucash-android-account-import-guide/

If you still have trouble afterwards, write me a mail and I can try to look deeper into it.
Regards,
Long time user

Nope, spoke to soon, still ruined, still rubbish

title: Working again.
comment: If there was a way to import transactions, I'd give it five stars. Also, I'm not sure if other people have this problem, or if it is just my overused phone, but the add transaction button doesn't always open the new transaction window until I change screens and come back to the account transactions screen. Especially if coming from the widget.

Hi Josh, 
I apologize for not communicating these changes better. The recent change now computes balances using accounting principles followed by GnuCash desktop. However, all your data should be there. You cannot import transactions from the desktop to mobile app, only the account structure. But you can export your transactions from the mobile app

title: The best.
comment: After searching through a LOT of different double-entry accounting apps, none are as complete as GnuCash. Truly a great implementation and I'm surprised something this good is free <3

This was fixed in the version 1.3.3. 
Sorry about the broken update. Working to make sure it doesn't happen again.

title: Last update - booh!!!
comment: After the last update all the account balances are calculated wrongly, so it has become useless. The transactions are still there and seem correct... So please fix or i shall eliminate. About 8 months of transaction history!

This was fixed in the version 1.3.3. 
Sorry about the broken update. Working to make sure it doesn't happen again.
The upgrade destroyed my data...

title: Super!
comment: Amazing app!

title: Awesome
comment: Awesomé  Awesome...Just What i had been looking for..
Too complex.

title: Potential
comment: BUT, for this to be of use, and for me to even use GNUCash versus another app, for desktop and mobile, they must BOTH SYNC.  Without that functionality, this app is useless. I have to export everything every-time I make a change, and that's not efficient at all.  At least a Google Drive integration.  This app has potential, lots, but it has to improve with its efficiency.
Does exactly what I need and does not ask for my account information

title: Best
comment: Easy to use

title: Nice interface
comment: Nice and easy to use interface. Gets the job done.
Does multi currency work here?if yes how to adjust exchange rate?if i have hryvnya it shows 0 in USD...

title: Pointless without desktop integration
comment: I was expecting to be able to view and edit the accounts I already have in the desktop version. But it was not able to open the accounts file synchronized through Dropbox.

title: Simplified my life
comment: The Gnucash desktop program helped me correct some errors that were caused by the old way I was keeping my books. Just today successfully imported the account structure onto the Android app. Only wish I could see the running balances on the app rather than all zeros. I know it's not possible to have the app do everything the desktop program does, but last balances would be nice.
The thing I'm missing is automatic synchronisation with the desktop app

title: Not able Import
comment: I'm not able to import my accounts.. I had backed up in both qif & ofx formats, but none of them worked.

title: WTH!!! CRASHING!!!
comment: After updating the app its crashing. May be if I remove the cache it will work fine. But I will lost data which is very important. What I should do now???????

title: No cloud sync
comment: The app is good as such, but I lost my data in it because of absence of cloud sync and phone memory corruption.  I agree since it's an add on to desktop app, cloud sync may not be that useful. But you should consider making automatic exports of the data to something like, say Google Drive or a Samba share on the network.  I lost all the data 😢  Partly my fault, but it could get better. Please consider my suggestions seriously.

title: Not Working
comment: "The account structure is gotten from the desktop app with File -> Export -> Export Accounts" What format? There are 6 different possibilities. I am just getting, "An error occurred while trying to import account structure."   Edit: Thank you for responding so quickly. I was selecting Account Structure. By the way despite setting my default currency first and closing the app when I created a default set of accounts they were all created in pounds.

Hey Stephen, 
Thanks for the feedback. It should be an XML file. Sorry if this is not clear.
See this post for details: http://www.codinguser.com/2014/03/gnucash-android-account-import-guide/
Cheers,

title: Excellent but ....
comment: Excellent but no password protection

title: Good accounting software but huge bugs
comment: This app is good, but very huge bugs. first cause is income have raise is credit Transfer account (asset cash) also credit. but the natural phenomena income when raise credit transfer account (Asset cash) will be debit. so i request the gnucash team kindly review the windows version, because windows version is perfect.﻿

Hi Osaf, thanks for the feedback.
I've had some other similar reports and now understand better what you mean. 
The bugs will be ironed out in coming versions.
Cheers,

title: Promising
comment: Looks good so far. Would use if I was able to import from Ubuntu one service

title: Not a companion app
comment: Can't open existing gnucash files.

Hi, 
GnuCash Android is a companion app, which means it is useful for recording expenses on-the-go and importing them into your main GnuCash file. It does not support opening your GnuCash files. However you can export your account structure from GnuCash desktop and import it into the app.
Cheers,

title: good app
comment: its just enough for personal finances(the android version)

title: Double-entry income credit bug
comment: Firstly, thank you so much for making GnuCash and this Android app!   I'm not sure I'm doing this right, but when I enter a new transaction and mark it as a credit, I expect to see a corresponding debit in another account. Instead, I see a corresponding credit.    Specifically, I entered a $100 income credit and expected to see a $100 asset debit, but got a $100 asset credit instead. If I try to change the asset credit into a debit, the income credit automatically changes from to a debit as well. Am I doing something wrong? The desktop app behaves as I expected. It's just this Android app that behaves strangely.  I have double-entry accounting enabled and I imported my accounts from the desktop app's XML file.  Reply: That's my problem actually. I want them both to be positive, but instead one is negative.

Hi Jesse, thanks for the feedback. The accounting principles that the app works with are the same like for GnuCash on the desktop. Debits in Asset accounts *increase* the balance, while credits decrease it. If you do the same transaction in desktop Gnucash, from an Income account to an Asset account, you will see both entries as positive. Cheers,

title: Waiting for the accounts imports feature
comment: Great App - but full synchronization (including account)with GnuCash desktop applications is a must for it to be called a "companion app".  Currently you can import the account hierarchy (chart of accounts) from the desktop to the app, and export full accounts from the app to the desktop.  I am waiting for the day I will be able to import accounts from the desktop to the app

title: Great app and almost perfect when use with desktop gnucash
comment: This app like the desktop gnucash has been evolving n improving and the developer really deserves pat on the back. Just a bug I would like to point out. Whenever I export a qif to gnucash, those amounts with 0.50 will always become 0.51. Not sure its my problem or its a persistent problem. Anyway still very good since I use it for personal. Thank you very much gnucash!
Thanks for review. I will look into the export error you mention.

title: Nice
comment: Great to track your expenses on the go, and import them later to the full blown gnucash. Thanks to recent updates very usable even with complex account structures

title: Very limited
comment: At the moment this app can only import the account structure from an existing data file, in which case the accounts are empty. I need to be able to operate on a current data file in Dropbox and save it back again.

You are correct, the app is meant to be a companion application to the desktop app not a replacement or fully functional copy.
Sorry if that was not properly communicated.

title: Big fan, but ill wait for the bug fixes
comment: I am a Big FAN of Gnucash desktop.I am in fact learned Double Entry accounting though it; from how consistent and documented the double entry accounting rules are. However, the Gnucash app fails in that regard, I hope they work on fixing these bugs out. I can't really zero in the problem, is it credit debit mix-up or the balance is not calculated correctly ( taking in account when credit means increase or decrease -Maybe). It has a good intuitive Deign.Everything else about good, even without the ability to synchronize with the desktop Gnucash.

title: Double-entry accounting is not default
comment: My first impression was that the Double-entry accounting is missing. Thanks for your quick support about the setting for enabling it. My suggestion is to keep it enabled by default because that the top feature of GnuCash.
Double-entry accounting has to be enabled in Settings -> Transactions

title: Lacks compatibility with desktop version
comment: Pro:  - Not a cloud app - easy to keep track of cash Con: -Still unable to import accounts from gnucash desktop application.

title: Account structure now sorted
comment: Revising my previous review now that account list is sorted. Need to do some more testing now that this is fixed

The accounts are sorted, just by the simple name. 
Hierarchical sorting of accounts is coming tomorrow in version 1.3.1.
Cheers,

title: Convenient
comment: Works well to track expenses as they occur. Easy enough to import them to GnuCash on the desktop later.

title: Thanks!
comment: It's very helpful for me.

title: Perfect companion to desktop GnuCash
comment: Exactly what I needed: register casual cash expenses on the go and add them to main accounting in the end of the month. With dropbox integration, it is almost seamless. Thanks,  good job!

title: Still misses the mark
comment: I don't think much thought has been given to usability of this app as a companion to GnuCash mobile users. Favorite accounts should be shown first (or only) on double entry as categories.

title: Great app but with no integration
comment: It's a great app. It only lacks integration with the desktop version.

title: Excellent!
comment: I have been using gnucash desktop for 2 years now and it has been invaluable. I have been waiting for this, and it will only get better with time. Im expecially waiting for when it can use the same sqlite database with the desktop one.

title: Great application
comment: Would really like to see full compatibility with the desktop version. But it does what it says it does!

title: GNU = AWESOME
comment: I recommend this to anyone.

title: Good
comment: The interface is simple. Learning curve is little high. Need many features like handling different accounts (books), Summary/statistical details, graphs, syncing with guncash desktop version, some default settings like double accounting, bug fix for default currency needs deleting and re-adding of accounts, different tabs for different accounts, recurring payments etc. Will monitor in future releases.

title: Nice
comment: Integration with desktop version is a hassle though: one needs to export transactions and then import them manually in gnucash

title: Photos and spare-time
comment: I use it at home. I think that the most significant thing for phone version is a "notes" about purchase. For example: I buy goods, minimum what I need -- is to make photo of goods and invoice. Optionally, if I have spare-time, I can write price and name. Also I want to synchronize this and PC's version and edit transaction.  Photo for transaction can be a killer-feature.

title: More to be done on adaptation
comment: I have been using the desktop version for years and I'm very pleased with it but when I tried to transfer my data on my phone I have failed miserably every time.
Hi, the app only supports importing your account structure to your phone, not the transactions.

title: Default currency not working
comment: Good that finally we get something on Android. Fully appreciate the fact it is quite early for the app. One thing I noticed is that changing of currency does not work - dollar remains there despite of the setting. Another annoyance is that by default when entering the amounts it enters values beyond decimal point rather than full amounts. Thanks.  Edit: 2012-12-05  OK, got currency to work OK - it might have come with one of latest updates - thanks. Still annoyed with having to enter extra zeroes each time at each amount entered. Anyone else has that?   BTW, export works beautifully and with the feature to enter default email address it is seamless. The import into GnuCash needs few clicks to create matching transactions depending from which assets they are funded from.  Keep up the good work! Adding one star more to the review. Edit 2013-12021. QIF export and then import to Desktop Gnucash works Great

title: So far so ok
comment: Few more features to bring it up to par with desktop version. Keep it up guys!

title: Great app
comment: I am using this software for personal use, both desktop and Android versions I have. Can we have scheduled transaction facility in mobile app?
Thanks. Scheduled transactions coming in next major revision, currently in testing

title: Simple and useful
comment: It is very simple to use and I liked it. It would be nice if syncing was introduced, and the final financial statement after adding all the credits and debits. But still I love it.

title: Doesn't work.
comment: Could not get the app to import from my desktop. Why doesn't the instructions for importing work?  I wrote this review 3 months ago and it appears that nothing has changed in the program. I did just get a response from the people who made the app but that doesn't help.

Are you importing your account structure or your whole GnuCash file?
Remember that not the whole GnuCash file can be imported, but just the account structure gotten from File -> Export -> Export Accounts

comment: It would be a good companion to my desktop application but my currency doesn't have cents so I need the smallest fractions to be exactly 1 and not 1/100 or what is it set to default. In other words I'm looking for an option to change or disable decimals in amounts (100 and not 100.00). Until I have this feature I give only 3 stars.
Excellent app

comment: Can't import

Great idea but useless for most transactions since I can't enter splits.   Is that a planned feature?	Great idea but useless for most transactions since I can't enter splits.   Is that a planned feature?

comment: I'm using double-entry accounting and when I import the OFX file (extracted from the mobile app) into the desktop app, the accounts rarely match and end up in the Orphan account.

title: Very handy companion to desktop app
comment: Well developed app. Very handy for keeping track of expenses on the go.  The developers are very responsive to the users' feedback.

That's the point of the feature. The idea is for reusing transaction templates. 
But yes, the date does not have to be changed. I'll fix that.

title: Great app in the making
comment: Very simple app with very 'to the point' interaction.   Need a way to export and sync with my Google Drive for backup.  Also need a default 'other' account in double entry mode.  Thanks for the good work.   This is the only app I found in the store that does not need access to the network and other important parts of my phone.

title: Great!
comment: Awesome application!

title: It's broken
comment: Every time I add an expense/spend on my credit card it shows as credit in the credit card account when I debit my bank to pay the credit card it again credits the credit card account and my expense doubles  Never had this on the linux desktop version Please fix it

title: Some issues
comment: Much better but no split transactions and can't transfer between different currencies. Needs exchange rate support.

title: Importing not working...
comment: Just compiled latest GNUCash (2.4.13) on my Debian Desktop, when I export my file and imported from my DropBox account everything is in zeroes, the accounts or assets are there with their names but no money, and who likes to see no money in their accounts? :)  Aside from that looks nice, but for my situation it doesn't work.  Thanks!  Will give 5 stars when this issue is fixed...

Importing is only meant to import the account structure, not the transactions. 
GnuCash desktop has many features and validations which make it infeasible to try to import them into the app. 
This app is only meant to be a companion app where you record transactions and then import them to desktop GnuCash.

title: Handy but unreliable
comment: This is a great start and a nice way to keep tabs on day-to day spending. BUT ... I exported my accounts structure from Desktop Gnucash into Android GC and recoreded some expenses. I exported to a Dropbox file (nice, quick and easy) then tried to import back into Gnucash. I get an error message about an unknown account. I'm asked to selct or create an account to use for my transactions. This is puzzling since I mirrored the accounts into Gnucash Android and unchecked the local accounts when I set it up.

title: Unreliable
comment: This app looks great and promising, but it's clearly not mature. Importing an existing account structure has never worked for me. Every now and then, the app crashes. Importing the generated OFX files into GnuCash doesn't work reliably either: the accounts are typically assigned wrong and with double-enty accounting enables, all transactions show up twice in the import. Also, I've lost data several times. These days, I use "Expense Register" instead.

Hi Peter, sorry for the trouble you're having with the app. 
I have made some updates which should fix reliability. You can join the beta program to test this out by joining the Google+ community:
https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104728406764752407046

title: Great app.
comment: This makes keeping tracking of where money is at and went very easy.   Looking forward to tighter integration in the future. Keep up the great work!

title: Good stable and useful
comment: Even if you are not a gnucash zealot. This is a great mobile cash recorder. i use it most days and it operates flawlessly on s4. Would give it 5 if it seamlessly integrated to gnucash db

title: Nearly Perfect
comment: I find this app brilliant for what I use it for... recording my spending whilst out and about and then transferring to GnuCash Desktop. Never had any problems exporting OFX or importing account structure from the desktop version. The only thing I would wish for is split transactions in the double entry mode, without this I find this mode useless tbh.

title: nice app
comment: But could you just make it so it syncs with gnucash desktop version ? automatically

title: Great project. Pointless without cloud sync.
comment: Currently setting up my business accounting in Gnucash. Works well on the desktop (Ubuntu) and was excited it had android capability. A bit rubbish though when import from Dropbox and Google Drive currently amount to little more than an error.  Being an awesome open source project I'm sure this is in hand but this android version is rendered unusable to me until this is fixed.

title: Sub-accounts
comment: Without using double entry this app works great for me.   How do I add a sub-account? Previously I created some but I can't see any more how to do it?!

When you create an account, the last input field is for selecting the parent account. You need to check the checkbox for a parent account and then select one. 
Note that the field for parent account is only displayed if you have some accounts already existing in the database.

title: Nearly there
comment: I have tried it and works really well. There is some issue with investments i think. I use gnucash for multiple situations and in one perticular case it keeps reporting import error. Since the only difference is some stock investments in that account, i think that maybe it. But it is still ace in my book.

title: Does not work correctly
comment: a YouTube demo would be great, the ofx file does not import transactions correctly...keep saying I have to create new accounts.

title: Just one feature request
comment: Please add an opening balance field in the edit account screen.  Then at least I can track the balance of my bank account on the go as I enter receipts. Otherwise I've got to check separately online or wait until I've imported into the desktop program. Otherwise it's a very handy app for gnucash desktop users.
Duly noted.
1) Import failed from DropBox  2) No Israeli shekel in Android app? Banning Israel? :)

There is the New Israeli Shekel in the currency list. Has been there from the beginning.
Importing should be working more reliably now.

title: Not quite ready, but keep it up!
comment: This app is a work in progress. Needs split transactions and is buggy with double entry activated. Needs to import .gnucash XML files. Close to full featured. Keep up the good work! Soon this app will be a desktop replacement or mobile supplement to desktop gnucash. Can't wait for the app to be standalone.

title: Error importing
comment: Tried with two  files.

title: Man I love GnuCash but...
comment: online sync!  I use spideroak, and currently that apps doesn't provide a...so to speak.."widget API", meaning when you go to import your account from GnuCash mobile, you see dropbox and gdrive, but not spideroak.  This is more an Android/SpiderOak issue.  If GnuCash had a syncing feature tied to an account , man that would be sweet!

title: Importing problem
comment: Iam not able to import OFX file from my tab to phone.There was an error while importing.Please fix this.I want to use same account on my both devices.Thanks developer for simple accounting.

title: Just like GNUCash desktop
comment: As an ardent lover of GnuCash desktop, I was looking for a good mobile companion. My search ended here, and to get the same application in mobile form is really great. This now tracks transactions in my wallet which I export to desktop once in a week. Thanks a lot for this wonderful app! Now where's the donate button? :)

title: double entry not comprehensible
comment: I am not sure if I am doing the right thing with the double entry accounting with gnucash on android.  When I turn on double entry accounting. It is creating two distinct records on my android app.   The two entries are not connected. When I import these into my desktop app. These are two disconnected entries both balancing by creating their own individual imbalance account entries.  Also when I edit and save any existing record in the android app it creates a new transfer entry. Because the app does not remember / know the previous entry it has already created.  Perhaps it is best to keep the double entry option turned off. Until this feature is properly fixed i.e.  Otherwise my preliminary experience is quite positive.

The app does not create two distinct records for transactions. 
However OFX support for double entry transactions is limited, hence GnuCash desktop tries to resolve the transactions as two separate ones. 
QIF export format is now supported in the app and that should make importing transactions much easier. Try it out and let me know!

title: Excellent app!
comment: Simple and practical.

title: Import problems
comment: I love the desktop version, but the app won't let me import the file from Dropbox.  Major disappointment.
Acc import errors perhaps linked to bad export but most/all seem to be there. FCs often but automatically restarts(?!). UI not great on my size screen

title: the best
comment: i am using the desktop version since 5 years, and am happy to see an android version. these are the apps that we should donate for.
Like a number of others, cannot import account structure with v1.2.2. Used the export function in desktop app and sent with dropbox. FC repeatedly.

title: Waiting for full XML import feature.
comment: I've been using Gnucash for 3yrs on Ubuntu, eagerly waiting to sync up my desktop GnuCash with Android app.

title: Export-import still fails. :-(
comment: Really hope this app eventually works. Gnucash on the desktop is fantastic.  latest update only shows the second subaccount of assets after import. Expenses appears intact but still not usable as a companion app for the desktop though. :-( more power to the developer for the effort.

title: Import still fails
comment: With 1.2.2, have accepted to create initial accounts offered and deleted all and then imported the account structure from dropbox (still don't see how to enable ubuntu one) - import imports upto the same point as before - about halfway in assets, with structure under expenses etc not imported.

title: Getting closer to desktop version!
comment: The new version has these features that made me give full stars: nested accounts, import account structure/tree from desktop version, able to delete accounts and/or transactions. But some features can be added to make it even more awesome! Split transactions, I really want this! Last time, double entries will not export nicely to desktop version, not sure it's fixed or not, and the screenshots in Google Play should be updated to show the latest version.

title: Good start. Needs work.
comment: Excited to try this after years of using the desktop version. Exported accounts from desktop but got errors importing them into this. It appears there may be a limit of 100 accounts. That will make this pretty useless for me. Hopeful for an update soon.

title: Crash crash crash
comment: I can't even just open the application. Err~ this is bad. Please fix it immadiately!

Sorry about that Rizki. Crashes should be fixed in version 1.2.3
Keep the feedback coming, it helps improve the app.

title: Import don't work
comment: Lousy....just starting to use already hitting problems...import don't work..  Reply to developer> Yes I exported only account hierarchy and imported the same but didn't work. Others had the same comments for v1.2.2 and you're still giving this same unhelpful reply. Disappointing.

I should reiterate that the app does not support the full GnuCash files. Only your account structure (hierarchy) which you can get by going to "File -> Export -> Export Accounts" in Gnucash for desktop.
This allows you to use the same account structure on the desktop on the phone. But you cannot move your full GnuCash file between the two.

title: Great
comment: Good complement to the free and open source Desktop version, although not a replacement.

title: Was excited, am disappointed
comment: I have been using GNUCash since 2009 in my desktop. I was excited to learn about the launch of android version. But i just cannot import the account structure (from dropbox), and i am really disappointed about it.

The issue should be fixed now (as of v1.2.2). 
Make sure you are importing just exported accounts from Gnucash desktop. Not the whole GnuCash XML file. 
You can export your account hierarchy under File -> Export -> Export Accounts

title: Import working with v1.2.2
comment: Thank you for the update.  When I click any account, the account pane is about 20% and transactions pane is about 80%  Can this be made adjustable ?  This will help in viewing the summary of sub-accounts.  Also in the drop down menu that lists all the accounts, can the accounts be listed in  hierarchical order instead of alphabetical order?  This avoids confusion in case there are multiple sub-accounts with same name.  Eg.  Income:spouse,  assets:spouse, liabilities:spouse:credit card
Import now working (as of v1.2.2)

title: Handy tool
comment: A handy little tool for keeping track of spending on the go.
How to sync with my data stored on mysql server

title: no compatibility with GnuCash Desktop!
comment: I save my GnuCash files with Dropbox and edit them on different PCs, and thought this App would use my regular save files from Dropbox. Unfortunately, it doesn't do that (al least not yet). That's why I have to give it a 4; it's an excellent App but it's useless for me if it's not auto synced to my PC installations
Would be nice to be able to sync from computer to app/ visa versa & reacurring bills, etc. & calender.

title: Good start, but not on par yet
comment: Clear interface but missing functionality: - Interactive import in mother app - Tree structure of Accounts - Synching of accounts with mother app …

title: Excellent with awesome developer!
comment: This is am awesome app, I use it all the time. I contacted the developer yesterday about a nested accounts ui and he got back to me the very next day :-)   This feature is on the development version and should be in the next version release making this app incredible :-D

title: The Best!
comment: The best cross platform accounting software!   For those who are trying to import Android data into your computer :  Make the exact mapped account on the device. For example on Android make "Dining" under expenses.   During import make sure you map them properly.

title: Basic but Works
comment: Would be nice to be able to import accounts from the desktop version and to do split transactions..

title: Simple, but functional
comment: Makes a nice tracker of my wallet for later export to my desktop. Would appreciate better support for non-decimalized currencies like JPY.

title: Input is easy.
comment: Well... it's hard to imagine it easier to put transactions in on my 7" tablet in landscape mode.  It organizes transactions by date sections in a pleasant fashion.  It doesn't have a make a new budget option yet.  It doesn't import yet.  Still, it does what it does well.
Integrates with GnuCash Desktop. Enter transactions on the app when away from your desktop then import the transactions into the desktop.

title: Good app missing mathematical functions
comment: I wish mathematical functions be added to the app while entering transactions.  Ben

title: Samsung galaxy tab2
comment: Add inventory in this.

title: Getting there
comment: Public domain, grows from good users & developers.  Looking forward to see what is added next ( 2way sync pls)...
Fantastic. Very useful

title: Amazing app.
comment: I've tried 7 other expense apps and they all fell short by design and/or functionality. The simplicity and beautiful design of this app is what sets it apart. However, its slightly too simple. This app would get 5 stars if it had a few advanced features such as recurring transactions, total of all accounts, and graphs/pie charts.

title: error exporting ofx file
comment: Nice little app. It saved me from keeping receipts in order. However, I think that without the support for sync with normal gnucash files, the best would be to have a spreadsheet format for exported files. Being the end of the year I wanted to print a list of expenses for my accountant: however, the error exporting the file kept bothering me. Any hint? Thanks

title: No double accounting
comment: The app should:  - import an account tree exported from the desktop version - take double-entry transactions (one of the strengths of gnucash!)  It looks promising, but it needs more work

title: All good, except no import
comment: Without the ability to import an existing gnucash file (in xml or sqlite3 format), this app is useless for users who wish to sync between PC and phone via Dropbox or a similar solution. Please add import support and necessary peripherals for syncing to PC via Dropbox!!

title: good and simple
comment: but i'd prefer some more practical features

title: Works! (prev: Cannot change from USD to EUR)
comment: Double edit: I get it now. If you want a currency other than USD, then cancel the first account creation screen where you are presented with a checkbox list of premade accounts. Switching to another currency later will not change already existing accounts. Back out of the program, return and manually add your accounts with the correct currency. Edit: I reinstalled the app a few times and that didn't help, but magic dev fairies must have visited my phone in the night because everything seems to work now. The widget is fantastic too. The ability to rename or delete accounts would be useful. Really though, great work.  (prev: I for one like the straightforward nature of this app as strictly a receipt managing program. However, despite selecting EUR as my currency it remains USD and this breaks the functionality of importing the resultant OFX file. I've been using the desktop version for a couple years now and this would be a perfect solution if only I could change the currency.)

title: Unusable on my Samsung Galaxy
comment: It is impossible to type the amount. The keyboard goes into "autorepeat" on some of the numbers. So I type a 4, and then it starts repeating the 4.. ending up with 444,444,444,444,444.00. I don't think it is to do with my phone: other apps seem to work fine.

title: Value beyond decimal point is useless
comment: It is very annoyable to have to enter values beyond decimal point. They are absolutely useless for my currency Russian rubles. Anyway great app for the start. Thanks!

title: Sub Accounts
comment: I will like to know how to create sub accounts under each account just like in the pc version

title: I can't adapt easily
comment: I include on the app expenses that I have with my cash and debit card, I can't import them separate to gnucash desktop program. Since my expenses has one million subaccounts I just can't find an easy wait to do the import. I had a telly high expectation for this app.

title: Too early but glad to see
comment: Glad to see this but it is released far too early. Most users of this will want to access existing data, I use mysql formal to save to a hosted DB - this would be a big plus if it can simply open from the net over mysql and I am looking forward to testing properly then :)

title: Gnu cash doesn't work on Galaxy note with Android 4
comment: Pity as portability with pc seemed promising

title: Great first version!
comment: Hope improvements will continue. Import accounts names from desktop app would be great

title: Good start
comment: Too early to tell what this app will become. Really hope for syncing with desktop gnu cash.

title: Easy transaction entry for on-the-go GnuCash users
comment: This app is perfect if you use GnuCash on a computer but want to collect transaction data when you're away from it.  Set up a widget, enter cash transactions as they happen, then email the transactions to your computer for quick and painless import into your GnuCash database.

title: Nice work
comment: I am one off the gnu cash desktop user. nice app for starting.  i hope in future update we can easily sync our account from pc to mobile and mobile to pc. one feature that is missing here in app is security lock feauter as this is mobile and if it lost all finical detail will gone.. i hope developer will understand the important.. else good..work..

title: Nice
comment: This is a good start. Ive been using gnu cash in desktop. Now u guys is in mobile. 5 stars are waiting if u guys add sync with desktop and compabilities with desktop files.

title: Useless
comment: Impossible to sync with desktop app

title: Nice starting point
comment: I like to see some more features like pass lock code, storing&exporting data to cloud storage. Good work! Hope you will continue to dev it!

title: Good but missing double entries
comment: It would be nice if I could credit my credit card account with the same expense debit transaction so when I export to my desktop GnuCash l do not have to do anything.

title: Can't wait for compatibility with desktop version
comment: Desktop app is great. 5 stars as an encouregement to make android version compatible with desktop database.

title: Kepp going
comment: I look forward to syncing with desktop. Currenty there's not much function. Keep up the good work!

title: Great start, but not useful compared to competition.
comment: The app is quite useless at this point, and there are much better competitors. For us desktop gnucash users, this app only becomes useful when's I can open.the files from my desktop gnucash app. If I could open either them via Drobox or gdrive, this would be an awesome app. so I will patiently wait and give this app creator a you go man! I would love to do gnucash accounting on the go!

title: Financial management in your pocket
comment: Very nice to see the release of this little application. Basic but quick and easy to use and looks easy enough to integrate with the desktop application. Am looking forward to seeing future releases.

title: I see a lot of potential
comment: Right now the app allows me to track expenses with little other functionality.  I was under the impression that in could track my monthly finances and budget targets with this app, but there is no reporting or date ranges to do that with.  On the plus side, it is open source! I can implement these things on my own!
